reviews.title: Okay, but not for the price
reviews.text: We booked the Brigadoon based on recommendations from a coworkers parents who had stayed there and raved about it. We booked the "romance package".

reviews.title: Repeat visits are a must!
reviews.text: Brigadoon's web site promises beverages and snacks upon arrival - we didn't see any out and we weren't offered any. There also wasn't any in our room. We also never received the chocolates and cookies promised on the web site that were included in the romance package.

reviews.title: Wonderful place for a family reunion!
reviews.text: The owner, Sharri, is very nice and friendly. She is very welcoming. She is very knowledgable about the area and very accomodating to the guests. She is definitely the propertys best asset.

reviews.title: Perfect Blend of Old World Charm and Modern Conveniences!
reviews.text: Our room was on the ground floor. The furnishings were worn and the carpet was buckled. Very minor things and not something we would get upset about. The tv in the room is very small and in an bad location for viewing.

reviews.title: First rate accomodations
reviews.text: The people above us bathed for 2.5 hours on Friday night. From 10:00 PM to 12:30 am. And we could hear EVERYTHING. Then they started again at 6:30 am. For the price ($495.00) for the weekend - I expect sound proof rooms. It was not pleasant to say the least.
